qas.question: What political party did not have trust in standing armies?
Who did the state militias have ongoing conflict with?
Who was defeated at the Battle of the Wabash?
In what year was the Legion of the United States established?
In what year was the Legion of the United States renamed to the United States Army?
What person did not trust the standing armies?
Who did the state militia have an ongoing peace treaty with?
Who was killed at the Battle of the Wabash?
In what year was the the government of the United States established?

context: After the war, though, the Continental Army was quickly given land certificates and disbanded in a reflection of the <a0_0><b5_0>republican<b5_0/><a0_0/> distrust of standing armies. State militias became the new nation's sole ground army, with the exception of a regiment to guard the Western Frontier and one battery of artillery guarding West Point's arsenal. However, because of continuing conflict with <a1_0><b6_0>Native Americans<b6_0/><a1_0/>, it was soon realized that it was necessary to field a trained standing army. The Regular Army was at first very small, and after <a2_0><b7_0>General St. Clair<b7_0/><a2_0/>'s defeat at the Battle of the Wabash, the Regular Army was reorganized as the Legion of the United States, which was established in <a3_0><b8_0>1791<b8_0/><a3_0/> and renamed the "United States Army" in <a4_0>1796<a4_0/>.
